entries.message: The issue with the switch has been resolved and service has been returned to normal. Thank you for your continued patience.
We are currently experiencing a partial outage in our New Jersey location. Our System Administrators are actively working with our onsite technicians to restore service as quickly as possible.

Event Type: Network Upgrade

We are performing system changes in the Paris location during the following scheduled maintenance window. 

Start Time: 2024-03-14 23:00:00 UTC
End Time: 2024-03-15 03:00:00 UTC

We schedule higher impact maintenance events during off-peak times to reduce impact to customer infrastructure. Our engineers make every effort to minimize system impact, however, network reachability to Paris instances may be affected for some, or all, of the scheduled maintenance window as we perform this work. While it’s important to be aware of start and end times of the maintenance window, due to our redundant network architecture, our engineers expect that you may see little to no impact at all while the work is performed.

Event Type: Storage Infrastructure Maintenance
Start Time: 2024-03-15 13:35:00 Europe/Stockholm
End Time: 2024-03-16 05:35:00 Europe/Stockholm

Our Cloud Storage team will be performing upgrades to our Stockholm deployment infrastructure starting at 2024-03-15 12:35:00 UTC. During this maintenance window, new deployments, snapshot functionality, and custom ISOs may be temporarily unavailable.

Previously deployed servers in Stockholm will remain online without interruption and will not be impacted by this event.

service_alerts.subject: Silicon Valley Snapshot and HDD Block Storage Upgrades - 2024-03-11

entries.message:
Event Type: HDD Block Storage Infrastructure Maintenance
Start Time: 2024-03-11 14:00:00 America/Los_Angeles
End Time: 2024-03-12 02:00:00 America/Los_Angeles

Our Cloud Storage team will be performing upgrades to our Silicon Valley HDD Block Storage infrastructure starting at 2024-03-11 14:00:00 America/Los_Angeles (09:00:00 UTC). During this maintenance window, new deployments, snapshot functionality, and custom ISOs may be temporarily unavailable. Also, during this maintenance window, creating, attaching, resizing, and deletion of HDD Block Storage volumes may be temporarily unavailable.

Previously deployed HDD Block Storage volumes in Silicon Valley will remain online without interruption and will not be impacted by this event.

service_alerts.subject: Potential service disruption in Tel Aviv

entries.message:
The Constant Company, creator of Vultr, is aware of and following the situation in Israel. At this time we do not expect any disruption of service in our Tel Aviv location.  We will continue to closely monitor services as the situation evolves, and we will advise our customers of any changes which have the potential to impact service delivery.

We believe this is a crucial time to remind our customers about the importance of the 3-2-1 Backup Strategy for safeguarding all critical data. Please see the case study here for more information: https://www.vultr.com/docs/case-study-use-a-321-backup-strategy-at-vultr/

Please note that Vultr Snapshots and Backups are stored in the same location as the instance they are made from, however when you deploy a new instance from them in a different location, they will be automatically transferred and stored in the new location as well.
